abstract.p: Royal Philips Electronics earned 771 million euros ($655 million), more than expected and up from 331 million euros ($282 million) in quarter a year earlier; sales grew 21 percent, to 9.4 billino euros ($8 billion) (S)

block.p: Royal Philips Electronics, the Dutch semiconductor and consumer electronics company, said third-quarter profit more than doubled as it sold more chips that power mobile phones and other digital products. Philips earned 771 million euros ($655 million), more than expected and up from 331 million euros ($282 million) in the quarter a year earlier. Sales grew 21 percent, to 9.4 billion euros ($8 billion).

Royal Philips Electronics, the Dutch semiconductor and consumer electronics company, said third-quarter profit more than doubled as it sold more chips that power mobile phones and other digital products. Philips earned 771 million euros ($655 million), more than expected and up from 331 million euros ($282 million) in the quarter a year earlier. Sales grew 21 percent, to 9.4 billion euros ($8 billion).
Suzanne Kapner WORLD BUSINESS BRIEFING: EUROPE
